com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context
Class AbstractContext

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context.AbstractContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
Context
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultContext, ServletContext
public abstract class AbstractContext
extends Object
implements Context

Convenience superclass for classes that would like to implement Context.

All of the work regarding variables is delegated to a number of scopes, which subclasses have to provide when constructing an abstract context. The scopes are prioritised, which can be seen when finding a variable: the value in the scope that has the highest precedence will be used.

All scoped variables are made available as implicit objects using scope maps; the names that will be used are obtained by suffixing the scope names with "Scope". As a consequence, no other implicit objects can have a name that ends with that suffix.

Subcontexts are supported, but the createSubcontext method throws an exception, since it doesn't know which context class to instantiate. Subclasses that want to support subcontexts have to override this method and delegate to a constructor that calls the constructor that accepts a parent.

public static final String IMPLICIT_OBJECT_SCOPE_NAME_SUFFIX
The text that is appended to the name of a scope to get to the name that will be used for the implicit object for the scope.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

AbstractContext

protected AbstractContext(Scope... scopes)
                   throws ContextException
Creates an abstract context.

Parameters:
scopes - the scopes that are supported by the context; the first scope has the lowest priority, the last scope the highest one
Throws:
ContextException - when the list of scopes does not contain the template scope or when two scopes have the same name

AbstractContext

protected AbstractContext(AbstractContext parent,
                          Scope... scopes)
                   throws ContextException
Creates an abstract context that's the subcontext of another context.

Parameters:
parent - the parent context
scopes - the scopes that are supported by the context; the first scope has the lowest priority, the last scope the highest one
Throws:
ContextException - when the list of scopes does not contain the template scope or when two scopes have the same name

addScope

public String addScope(String name,
                       boolean requireUniqueName)
                throws ContextException
Description copied from interface: Context
Adds a scope.

Specified by:
addScope in interface Context
Parameters:
name - the name of the scope to add
requireUniqueName - whether the name is expected to be unique; if it isn't, this context is allowed to change the name to ensure its uniqueness
Returns:
the actual name of the new scope: this will be the same name as was requested if it should be unique, it could be different if a scope with the requested name already exists and the name is not required to be unique
Throws:
ContextException - when the name has to be unique and there already is a scope with the given name

isScopeRemovable

protected boolean isScopeRemovable(String name)
Determines whether a scope can be removed. This implementation checks whether the scope is the template scope.

Parameters:
name - the name of the scope of which should be determined whether or not it may be removed
Returns:
true if it's permitted to remove the scope with the given name, false if it isn't

findVariable

public Object findVariable(String name)
                    throws ContextException
Description copied from interface: Context
Finds a variable across all scopes. When multiple scopes have a variable with the given name, it's up to the context implementation which variable will be returned.

Specified by:
findVariable in interface Context
Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to find
Returns:
the value of a variable in one of the scopes with the given name
Throws:
ContextException - when not a single scope contains a variable with the given name
